name: GreyNoise for SOAR
description: This app provides investigative capabilities using the GreyNoise plugin and supports receiving alerts and feeds via webhook from GreyNoise
verbose: The GreyNoise Enrichment plugin for Splunk SOAR enriches observables to identify mass-internet scanning activity and can receive alerts and feeds via webhook from GreyNoise, providing context on IP behavior including intent, tags, first seen, last seen, geolocation, ports, OS, and JA3 to help prioritize investigations.

on_poll_query.description: GNQL query to use for the on poll action

on_poll_size.description: The number of results to return for the interval/schedule poll

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using the supplied configuration
actions.verbose: Tests the connection to the paid GreyNoise API.

actions.description: Lookup IP using GreyNoise API Quick Check Endpoint
Get full GreyNoise reputation and context for a specific IP
actions.verbose: Get more information about a given IP address. Returns time ranges, IP metadata (network owner, ASN, reverse DNS pointer, country), associated actors, activity tags, raw port scan, and web request information.

example_values: Google's global domain name system (DNS) resolution service.
Public DNS services are used as alternatives to ISP's name servers. You may see devices on your network communicating with Google Public DNS over port 53/TCP or 53/UDP to resolve DNS lookups.
IP addresses with this tag have been observed attempting to perform a Microsoft SQL (MSSQL) login.

actions.description: Use the GreyNoise Query Language to run a query
actions.verbose: Please refer to <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://docs.greynoise.io/docs/using-the-greynoise-query-language-gnql">https://docs.greynoise.io/docs/using-the-greynoise-query-language-gnql/a> for further information.

size.description: The number of results to return (warning: returning over 1000 results may degrade widget performance)

exclude_raw.description: If true, the raw data will not be included in the response

quick.description: If true, the response will only include the IP address and the classification or trust level

example_values: IP addresses with this tag have been observed crawling the Internet for unauthenticated web proxies and testing if they are functional.

actions.description: Lookup IPs using GreyNoise API Multi Quick Check Endpoint (comma-separated, limit 500 per request)
actions.verbose: Returns quick check information for multiple IPs.

actions.description: Get details on a specific GNQL query

container_count.description: Maximum number of results to return for the on poll action

actions.description: GreyNoise IP Timeline lookup for events matching a specific field
actions.verbose: The GreyNoise IP Timeline shows historical data on an IP address filtered by a specific field.

days.description: Number of days to show data for (Default: 30)

field.description: Field over which to show activity breakdown

granularity.description: Granularity of activity date ranges .This can be either in hour(1h) or in day(1d) (Default: 1d)

example_values: Lookup IP Timeline action successfully completed

actions.description: Retrieve details about a specific Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE)

cve_id.description: The CVE ID to query (e.g., CVE-2024-12345)

example_values: Fortinet Multiple Products Authentication Bypass Vulnerability

An authentication bypass using an alternate path or channel [CWE-288] in Fortinet FortiOS version 7.2.0 through 7.2.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.6, FortiProxy version 7.2.0 and version 7.0.0 through 7.0.6 and FortiSwitchManager version 7.2.0 and 7.0.0 allows an unauthenticated atttacker to perform operations on the administrative interface via specially crafted HTTP or HTTPS requests.
Get CVE Details action successfully completed
